definition: three-stroke form of Kangxi radical 94 犬[quan3]
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
hurricane/violent reform or revolution/violent movement or force
to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation

sentences.english: That is the entire stalker problem right there.
sentences.chinese: 這纔是整個跟蹤狂問題的癥結所在。

sentences.english: Mr Jobs emerges as a controlling and often unsympathetic character.
sentences.chinese: 喬布斯以控制狂兼冷血無情的面目出現。
圍觀者的讚美是施虐狂。

sentences.english: A whole valley of boulders tossed higgledy-piggledy as though by some giant .
sentences.chinese: 整個山谷裏巨石翻滾，就像有巨人在狂扔亂擲。

sentences.english: Over the green and yellow rice-fields sweep the shadows of the autumn clouds followed by the swift chasing sun.
sentences.chinese: 黃綠的稻田上掠過秋雲的陰影，後面是狂追的太陽。

sentences.english: In his pocket scraps of paper containing prescriptions for Weltschmerz.
sentences.chinese: 他的衣袋裏裝了一張張紙，都是治療悲觀狂的處方。

sentences.english: What’s the difference between a prowler and a stalker?
sentences.chinese: 小偷和跟蹤狂的區別在哪裏呢？

sentences.english: The doctor says that he is paranoiac.
I prefer the term rampaging thugs.
sentences.chinese: 我更喜歡狂暴徒這個詞。

sentences.english: What is the conclusion? I hope you enjoyed my “geeky tips”.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你喜歡我的“技術狂小竅門”。
圍觀者的讚美是施虐狂。

sentences.english: The tide will take, the sea will rise and time will rape.
sentences.chinese: 潮欲漲，浪更狂，整個時空即將就此湮滅。

sentences.english: The technophiliac route forward would lead to a reversionary future.
sentences.chinese: 這一技術狂路線會引領我們走向一個復古的未來。

sentences.english: Committed savers are those not afraid to go for the best deal.
sentences.chinese: 如果你鐵了心要做一個節省狂，那就別害怕砍價到底。

sentences.english: In addition, his beloved Yingzi, who once loved him crazily, falls in love with Mangan in the end.
sentences.chinese: 而曾狂熱愛着二子的英子最終也投入了麻桿的懷抱。

definition: hurricane/violent reform or revolution/violent movement or force
out of control/berserk/to go for a long walk
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
